revised_title: Harmonic Undertones: A Unique Sound Phenomenon
tldr: The article describes a unique sound phenomenon where a vibrating tuning fork causes a piece of paper to emit a note with significant harmonic overtones, similar to the sound of a bowed violin string. The paper vibrates irregularly due to the irregularity of the blows from the tuning fork, resulting in a complex sound. This phenomenon can be observed when the paper is lightly touched by the vibrating fork and does not remain in contact throughout the vibrations.
